item.title: Remembering The Mint Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Icon | Las Vegas History
item.description:
A Neon Beacon on Fremont Street: The Rise of The Mint

The mid-1950s were a period of explosive growth for Las Vegas, and no building symbolized that boom quite like The Mint Hotel and Casino. Officially opening its doors on July 12, 1957, The Mint wasn’t just a casino; it was a statement. Conceived by a powerhouse group of partners – Milton Prell, Al Winter, L.B. “Tutor” Scherer, and J.D. “Joe” Hall – with the astute Sam Boyd at the helm as general manager, The Mint aimed to be something special. And it succeeded, spectacularly.
